revised_title: Physics and Chemistry of Thermotropic Liquid Crystals: Disc-like Molecule Liquid Crystals
tldr: This article discusses the physics and chemistry of thermotropic liquid crystals made of disc-like molecules. It describes two distinct structural types: columnar and nematic. The columnar phase consists of discs stacked aperiodically in columns, while the nematic phase is an orientationally ordered arrangement of discs without long-range translational order. The article also presents a theoretical model for the phase transitions between these phases and the isotropic phase, which can help explain the behavior of these new liquid crystal systems.
